item.title: Holden penalised $1m for shutting down
item.description: Holden has been cut off from government payments worth more than $1 million following its shock decision to leave Australia.

item.title: Tailor JobKeeper to Vic crisis: Labor
item.description: Financial support through JobKeeper needs to be tailored to Victoria’s strict stage four lockdowns, Opposition leader Anthony Albanese said today.

item.title: New restrictions ‘regrettably necessary’
item.description: More mental health support will be offered for Victorians facing the toughest lockdown yet, Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt said today.

item.title: Craigieburn Woolies worker tests positive
item.description: A Woolworths worker has tested positive at the same store in Melbourne’s north where a nurse also contracted the virus last week.

item.title: Shoppers told mask up Monday
item.description: Shoppers at Woolworths-owned stores are being urged to wear face coverings from Monday.

item.title: Panic buying returns ahead of restrictions
item.description: Supermarket shelves have again been stripped bare across Melbourne on Sunday morning as a panicked city flocked to stores to stock up ahead of a looming announcement of tougher restrictions.

item.title: ‘This cannot be more serious’: Vic Premier
item.description: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews has announced a raft to tough new restrictions to try and stem spiralling coronavirus cases as the state recorded 671 new infections overnight.

item.title: Toddler dies after being pulled from dam
item.description: A coroner’s report is being prepared on a three-year-old girl died after being pulled out of a dam on Saturday.

item.title: Where NSW 12 new cases came from
item.description: NSW residents are being encouraged to wear masks as the state records 12 new coronavirus cases overnight, including a worker at a Merrylands childcare centre.

item.title: Pay workers for pandemic leave: Labor
item.description: Paid pandemic leave should be funded by employers and the federal government, Opposition treasury spokesman Jim Chalmers said today.
